abstract: Having assisted in the death of many newspapers, technology will save those that adapt.
snippet: Having assisted in the death of many newspapers, technology will save those that adapt.
lead_paragraph: The two visions of higher education's future I described in my column this week – Stanford Professor Sebastian Thrun's mission of a virtual university and Stanford President John Hennessy's devotion to a flesh-and-blood campus – intrigued me because of the larger context. So much of the debate about the impact of new technology tends to be polarizing. The utopians versus the skeptics, the idealists versus the realists, those who throw themselves headlong into the great mosh pit of the new, and those who cherish the familiar and time-honored.

headline.main: Disrupters and Adapters, Continued: Will the Internet Save Newspapers?
